Description: For sale an early 1970’s (serial #046) Rickenbacker 4001 in excellent, 100% original condition and in perfect working order. Original lacquer finish and neck through body construction. Equal parts midrange power and fundamental warmth available via the two original Hi-Gain single coil pickups. The bass is solid and well balanced at 9lbs 11oz, and has been professionally setup. The neck has a full, D shaped profile with roundness in the shoulders and a feel that's substantial yet fast. The 33 1/4" scale is Rickenbacker's traditional long scale, and the lacquered slab rosewood fret board features original frets and pearl triangle inlays. The slender frets have their full factory height and well rounded crowns, showing only light wear. The headstock features the original Rickenbacker logo/truss rod cover, as well as stock tuning machines which turn smoothly and hold pitch well. All of the electronics work as they should, with an original harness and CTS pots that date to the 1970’s. The Rick-o-Sound stereo jack plate has a cleanly stamped serial number with a "PA" prefex. All of the original chrome hardware and plastic parts are present and quite clean. Minor scratches associated with it’s age. The body has buckle rash on the back and a few scattered small nicks. A vintage (non-original) hard shell case is included.
Title: Vintage Rickenbacker 4001 Bass (Serial #046)
